reviewText:
Okay, first of all, the bad ending was the first one I did and it screwed with my mind so bad. God.
Seriously though, I spend a very large amount of time playing visual novels. Emphasis on very. I wasn't expecting much from a free one considering to get much quality at all I typically have to pay an excess of fifteen bucks (Things like Dysfunctional Systems being notable exceptions). This game has so much variety, the art isn't complete ♥♥♥♥, and depending on which route you take the plot is actually fairly good c: You can go the romantic/sexual routes or you can basically just go the whole AAAAAA IM LOSING MY MIND crapola. Honestly, I preferred the latter except when it came to the tsundere overload route :D
Anyway, this game has enough miku, tsundere, and panties to keep me happy :)
Uhhh. Only downside for me is that I can't go after the guys (like come on i need my daily glasses boy romance that I so heavily crave). The grammar is kinda screwy sometimes but unless you're a total tool you should be able to overlook it c:

reviewText: Just wonderful. I had a couple of visual novels before but this is one of the best I had. reviewText: This is a wonderful introductory light novel. The music is very pleasant and not overbearing, the backround artwork is very well done and pleasing to the eyes. The individual scene pictures are great, too. There are however too few character portraits for each of the main characters so their pictures do not always perfectly match what they're saying, but it's not a huge deal. The writing is this game's best feature; it's elegant, descriptive and poetic, though at times the Russian translation has not perfectly completed the transition into English, the thoughts and feelings behind every line are evident and do not detract from the experience or comprehension at all.\n\n10/10

reviewText: This is a wonderful introductory light novel. The music is very pleasant and not overbearing, the backround artwork is very well done and pleasing to the eyes. The individual scene pictures are great, too. There are however too few character portraits for each of the main characters so their pictures do not always perfectly match what they're saying, but it's not a huge deal. The writing is this game's best feature; it's elegant, descriptive and poetic, though at times the Russian translation has not perfectly completed the transition into English, the thoughts and feelings behind every line are evident and do not detract from the experience or comprehension at all.\n\n10/10

reviewText: Everlasting summer is a free Visual Novel that has some good and points to the storyline especially in the beginning and at the end don't really make any sense but what happens in between really sells the game. its the classic Visual Novel formula of “pick a choice” and the choice will have a + or a - outcome and in the end it tallies up your score and decides which girl you go with and whether you have a good or bad ending. Now the choices are pretty limited you can only pick from 4 girls there is 3 kinds of “secret routes” that you can go but 2 of them you have to unlock first the art is not great and it often changes quality in the scenes it did not really bother me but it was still noticeable a lot of the characters were also very boring and predictable to me I found myself enjoying only 2 of the 4 girl’s paths. I do like how if you have played through it once you can fast forward through the stuff you have already seen to make it faster to go down all the paths. I do have to say the game is very charming and peaceful the music is good and the dialogue is entertaining I just wish that “your” character was not so thick skulled sometimes. Its worth saying that there is nudity in the game *BUT* you have to download a file and put it in the game file because it was taken out and not every one has a “sex seen”. Overall its a very good Visual Novel that is *FREE* so I’d say go for it you have nothing to lose  The Final Review of Everlasting summer is a 7/10

reviewText:
About: Your are lonely guy who suddenly enters a whole new world after taking the 410 bus and passing out in which  he ends up in a soviet summer camp in the 80s  with grils... yum ^-^

If the art stlye bugs you or the Runglish this this is not the game for you. The English proof reading has be done but i do miss the odd Russian here and there. (there was this one scence where a girl cuaght my character peeping at her and then she went off screaming in Russian...)

The Art: meh/10  its stlyes are not consitant at all, this will turn many away and if you dont like what you see on the store page dont bother playing the game. im weird and i like all of the changing art stlyes given as it lets you see the characters differently,or in a worse light. Most will probably see is as bad is all cases and i will agree but its  free  ♥♥♥♥ man :D and if you really want story then dont let the art turn you off,

(Correct below >.> Thanks) Music: 8/10 made by composer Sergei Eybog. Overall i liked everything the music was played at the right times and the ending and main menu soundtracks have really grown on me, whenever i hear them i will always thing of this game.

Routes : there is not one solid ending there is at least 6 goods and 6 bad with  the two special routes and they are really special in their own ways,one gives you the final piece of the puzzle and wraps everything up, if you slug through the game to get there you will be satisfised enough to look at this game and smile. Some routes are like, yeah right and it just was happy ever after while others will leave you wanting more.

Alisa`s ending as the example was terrible but they did give another ending which was much better.

And for the special ending with Schrodingers cat  yeah thats the one you want.

Mods?: Yes and this allows you creators to make the endings you want, if yor good enough or play through someone elses mod allowing you to see your characters in a different life.This feature really makes this game much more as you can keep reading even though the book is finished eh?? D:

Fun: i had losts of fun with this even with the miku route. For thoes who actually read this you will find yourself amused with everything this free game has to after.

Things to note: If you do read the text rather than Tab or spam space your way through you will spend a very long time on this game , and me a not so fast reader spent 7 hours to win one route out of fourteenth.

There really is some good ♥♥♥♥ in here, from having a loli sleep on you like for three days to drunken sex with a tsundere after smashing yourself with vodka. theres a sense of exploration as every route is very unique and links together in one way or another. once finish one route you will find yourself wanting to go to the next and not being dissapointed in what you find.

Dont play this with family around , and if you downloaded the certian patch that floats around the guides you will get at least a dozen pics of *** for your personal plesure

About the patch :o its not really that much pron  its  like 98% story then 2% pron  its really not that much or grahpic at all. Its even censored >.>  ergh this double censorship really suits a game about the communist era.

play on one Pc only :c i made the mistake to rely on the cloud... Also the sync with steam button just didnt work with me.

Hitler

Lots of Russian foods

Your man character sometimes changes nationality

Cat girl in multiple dimensions

Russian Miku. with a japanese mom. Even she didnt escape Russofication.

reviewText: This is truly an amazing game. With 13 possible endings, there are many endings you can get on your first try (except for two of them, which require you to get all good endings and the Miku end). However, the English translation is not grammactically correct in some places and a few misspellings here and there, it can still turn out to be a great story line that gives you the bond between the main character and the others. The soundtrack for this game just adds more emotion, and it is one of my favorite things in this game; next to the characters and the story. If you are looking for a game that gives you feels or if you are a fan of Visual Novels, I would definitely recommend this game.

reviewText:
A Visual Novel written by russians? That piqued my interest just like Katawa Shoujo did, which was made by members of 4  chan. In general, VN's not written/made by a japanese company should turn out quite interesting (not always good, but interesting nonetheless) as they aren't that much influenced by the japanese culture. Japanese Highschools, japanese character archetypes, you name it.
That's why Everlasting Summer offers a different experience for someone who has already read some Visual Novels, but at the same time it performs well as a Novel for a beginner.

The first story arcs revolve around the girls and the camp and how Semyon's relationship with the girls will change him as a person. The secret" route (and to some extent the DLC) however focuses on the mysterious world Semyon landed in. This mix between romance and mystery is well done; The spacing and the writing is great
date: though the story is often pretty predictable...except for Miku's route
recommended: that was ride from the beginning to the end and the name of the achievement for this route fits perfectly: "What is this I don't even...". What I should mention though is
hoursPlayed: that while not a completely new idea
voteText: this mysterious world is pretty well "designed" and keeps the story really interesting; Especially that not everything will be explained about it and inviting the reader to make own assumptions.\nThe artwork sadly wavers from Triple-A quality to mediocre fanart
helpfulPercent: which sometimes damages the atmosphere as characters change the art-style from one scene to another. Good thing is that doesn't happen that often.\nThe soundtrack is pretty good
votesHelpful: though there are better ones out there with tracks that stick in one's mind. But still
votesTotal: it does it's job.\nOne thing worth mentioning is the implementation of the workshop
votesFunny: which opens up the option for altermate endings
commentsCount: continuations or completely new story arcs. Right now
column16: there aren't many english mods
column17: but that should change in the future.\n\nOverall
column18: I can only recommend this Visual Novel. The story and especially the world is darn interesting and I'm sure you won't be disappointed and/or bored by it."

reviewText: Some scenes struck me as odd in the way the characters behaved with one another, but that might just be my perspective as a US American. The story was engaging and I was up until 3AM trying to get to two of the endings. I recommend that you don't look at any of the guides until after you've unlocked at least one ending. I would recommend this at $15, but for free there's no reason not to try it. Thankfully, there is no hentai in this game (although you can download it off Soviet Games's website if that's your thing). It does however still contain a lot of adult situations, so avoid this visual novel if you are prudish. Also, this is a visual novel, so if you don't like reading then this isn't your thing.

reviewText:
Ok first of all keep in mind it is MY review and MY opinion.
If you have an other view on this game it's cool i'll respect that.
But do not hate on me or my review.

AND ATTENTION THIS TEXT  MAY CONTAIN SMALLER PLOT SPOILERS

!!!YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!

The Story:
You are playing a normal young man called Semyon (or teenager when comes to the camp).
One cold winter night he falls asleep in a bus and finds himself in a youth pioneer camp
in the wide country side of the former USSR. Well and as the title says it's summer,.. (suprise surprise)
Well and after arriving, you go and enjoy your new pioneers life in a camp with 90% girls and 10% boys.
yeah that was one of the more or less bad pionts of the VN,(untill now i didn't play the Yulia route so correct me
if i am wrong) Semyon never realy asks why he is back in the 80's.
It's like the situation: Dad
date:
why is the sky blue..?" Dad: "Because its blue my son." "Ok Dad I am fine with your answer."
Thats the only piont of the story for me to critizise.
The Rest of the story is yeah I would say a little bit over standart.
And I mean with the "Disappearance of Shurik Suzumia" the story was complet.

The Visuals:
Ok haven't much to say about them.
Well.I could critizise that the choosen sprites of the characters don't look that great as others  on the official website.
But I was fine with the choosen.
And keep in mind that it is free2play VN so you can't complain.

The Sound:
In my opinion
recommended: the music of that visual novel is fitting. It's kind of Keep calm and well keep calm soundtrack\nwich is perfectly underlining the mood of the game. But also have to say
hoursPlayed:
after maybe 6 hours I was sick of this soundtrack and replaced it with original pioneer and FDJ(like pioneers just from east germany)songs.

Final Verdict:

With the factors of Plot

reviewText: This is by far the best free game I've ever played.  I've got close to 30 hours in and I'm close to finishing all possible story lines.  I really wish there were more games like this.  The only con, if I had to choose one, is that the game is censored outside of itself and you have to download a patch for adult content.  As one of the achievements requires all pictures to be accessed, I'm not sure if you're able to complete it without the patch.  I'll have to update on that when I finish all story lines.  Otherwise, the character development is great, it's easy to navigate, and it continues to be entertaining every single time you play.  I'd pay money for this one!

reviewText:
Right from the beginning i felt that this game took it self seriously feeling that the writing itself was very well thought out and the acompanying music suited to the subject matter very well.
I found myself wanting more and more and trying to unravel the mysteries as they are presented having to go on further.
The background artwork is enough to take your breath away while the music on it's own is definetly worth giving a listen to.
As the story progressed  through the different options presented i felt more and more attached to the main character and holding my breath and wishing all would resolve itself, like the events being told were not just a mere story, but that they were happening unfolding before my very eyes.
If I could suggest just one thing definetly give this game ago, it is well worth the time invested and has a little bit of something for everyone in it,
On a side note the achievment names are quite funny and i found myself giggling at each one that unlocked.

I would rank this game at 4.5/5

Why are they missing that half a point, well the disconnect from the background art quality to the quality of the character sprites is probably the only part of this Visual Novel that i found to be a little of putting, though after you get used to it, the sprites do take on a charm of their own.

reviewText:
Fantastic visual novel. The plot is extremely interesting and fascinating, and you don't want to stop playing. The dialouge is great, the characters are dynamic, and overall it's a fun, laid back game. This is also a great game that can bring on emotions so brace yourself! The few problems are: 1) Grammatical errors occur now and then, 2) Sometimes the dialogue between characters can be back and forth in a weird and generally confusing manner, 3) some endings are kind of suprising in a negative way, due to the fact that a big build up may occur and the ending is subtle, and 4) It it heavily restricted on 18+ even though Valve censored the game and cut out all sexually explicit scenes.
Overall I reccommend this to any 16+ year old who likes a story and plot to keep you hooked and a really fun time.

PERSONAL IN DEPTH REVIEW: For a free game, this took 17+ hours to complete 100%. That in itself is amazing and worth the download. This game is so philisohpical and touching that it is my favorite visual novel so far. I'm not one for emotional games or anything but this had just the right amount in it and it was brilliant. Seriously, give this game a try you may be suprised on how sophisticated and deep the storyline is. You can get a brain freeze (the good kind, like eating a slurpee too fast) from playing this game.  Fantastic, wonderful, and captivating. Hope you have as much fun as I did playing it.

reviewText:
After playing this game(Or, Rather Reading it?) I can say that I loved it!

I have never been a big fan of these kinds of games(Well.. Novels or Books in general?) but this has surely shown me the light of them!
This game is quite the delight with its wonderful story, Deep characters, and outstanding art!(Music/Soundtrack and Visual Graphics).
To my eyes and ears this game has done its job, and at some endings got me quite emotional(Job Well done!)
It has a few issues but for what its worth, It is quite well done especially for a Free to Play game(or book?).

Not to mention it fits my interest of Soviet Stuff so thats an added bonus. ʕᵔᴥᵔʔ

Cant forget the 13 different endings. And Im glad I was able to get a good ending on my first go(Cause ya know. That Lena Bad Ending is a bummer!)

The graphics are great! Wonderful scenery, Great drawings!
The music is wonderful thanks to Sergey Eybog(Silent Owl) and Between August and December!
The story is very mysterious but very well satisfying and will have you wanting more!
The Characters are alright, but sometimes can bug ya a bit.(Especially the main character.)
Quite a bit of reading.(Well, What do you expect? its a Visual Novel"?)

Anyways my overall rating for this game is an 8/10. - Would Cry tears of sadness and joy again. ;-;

Thanks for reading! ʕᵔᴥᵔʔ"

reviewText: If you're new to Visual Novels then this is a good one to start with. Everlasting Summer introduced me to the wonderful world of visual novels and since then, I have been devoting most of my time to visual novels. Interesting concept, great artwork(characters, background), beautiful music, multiple endings; it is a perfect VN to say the least.  The story is excellent, it feels like you are in the VN itself: living the life of a pioneer in a camp and hanging out with the girls. At the beginning, you will have a lot of questions as to what is happening and why but later on, you will start to accept the way things are and enjoy it, reluctant to leave this beautiful place. How wonderful it will be to be in Semyon's shoes. The story stuck with me for a few weeks and I have to say the authors did a pretty good job embedding the VN in my mind. There's a reason why it is titled Everlasting Summer(Бесконечное лето)".\n\nConclusion: give it a try; you will love everything about it. Remember
date: there are multiple endings(14 to be exact)
recommended: so the story will be different for each choice you make. Stop pondering
hoursPlayed: and download it!\n\n9/10 - Excellent"

reviewText:
8/10.
This is the first game I have ever put in the effort to give a review on, which is saying quite a bit :D
It has an emotional and thought-provoking story (or should I say stories, because it has many endings)
It has a good story (stories...), a lot of replay value (multiple good/bad/neutral endings).  The path I took in my first playthrough was about 7-8 hours; despite being one of the bad endings, it still left me satisfied with the story (some of the endings are very... sad, and I don't reccomend doing Miku's route late at night o.O).  It has good visuals/graphics to go along with the story (and as of yet, no voice acting; in my oppinion it isn't even needed to enjoy the game).  The english translation is a bit shakey at times but bearable, and they say they are looking for someone to help with their translations.
Would reccommend.

reviewText:
Note: Ignore the amount of time played, I mainly played this offline so it should be more like 60 hours.

Like most I saw the ‘Free to play’ words and I immediately clicked on the game and played it. While I was waiting for the game to download I did notice it was Russian but that didn’t affect me at all since it’s in perfect English except for a few typos but that’s kind of inevitable, and you barely notice it. There are a few comments to some Russian culture in it but it is then explained for the non-Russians out there playing the game like yours truly.

When I started playing the game the first thing I noticed was that the background art was unbelievably gorgeous. The pictures that were digitally painted of the winter and even in Semyons apartment all looked fantastic and spot-on for the environment they were portraying and this background work does stay throughout most of the game but more so in specific parts for some parts of certain routes later on such as in Miku / Masha’s route which honestly was done very effectively. Some of the early CG’s aren’t the best and certainly could have done a better job of but the art of the CG’s gets progressively better throughout the game like the dance CG’s are nicely done and the CG’s for the endings are gorgeous, real top-notch stuff. When I completed the first ending I was shocked realise the massive difference between the CG with Ulyana and Lena and then the ending CG I was looking at! Talking about the girls:

The girls in this game are all a great dose of hilarity, insanity, brilliant and downright loveable. I honestly thought there were two in specific that I wouldn’t like but lo and behold, I loved them in the end. I’ll talk about them in the order of the walkthrough.

Slavya: She’s a sort of Yamato Nadeshiko but in Russia. She’s kind, helpful, hard-working and even seems to scold someone when she thinks they’re doing wrong. That is until Semyon catches her going to the forest late at night and alone… and he catches her skinny-dipping while she’s fully aware he’s watching her.

Lena: Lena was a character I thought I wouldn’t like. She starts as a complete shy wallflower who seems to like Semyon for little to no reason but then over her route her personality slowly changes until the climax in her and Alisa routes. She starts to become more doting on Semyon and more clingy until an argument between her and Alisa breaks out and she goes full Yandere. This was foreshadowed earlier when Semyon gets a mental imagine of Rena from Higurashi when seeing her for the first time.

Alisa: Alisa is my best girl, no argument. I knew from the starts what her personality would be. She’s a rebellious pioneer, with an embarrassing nickname and a hair trigger temper. Can you say Tsundere much? She loves to play her electronic guitar and also loves Rock’n’roll and has serious hidden depths if you give her the chance to show them after her tsun side calms down a bit. Also she and Lena don’t particularly like each other, cuz Tsun and Yan’s have always worked so well together (!)

Ulyana: Another character I thought I’d hate. I expected such a bratty half-pint when I was on her route and wanted to leave her till last but, whoa boy, does this game love its hidden depths! She does start as a bratty half pint who’s a complete tomboy but then has something resembling a slap-slap-kiss relationship with Semyon especially when she plays pranks on him but after one of her pranks she asks him with all seriousness one day ‘Why do you hate me?’ and after this the relationship thing they have going is pretty cute and harmless and I do like that the game avoided any squick territory it could have easily driven into.

Miku: Miku’s pretty much a complete airhead in the game seems to mainly have a motor mouth on her saying things with little to no connectivity. Halfway through her route though Masha happily comes out and turns the route and character on their heads, her and Slavya (now Sasha) have swapped personalities and turns out they were shooting a film but where this route goes is horribly dark and legit freaked me out.

Yulya: The only character I didn’t particularly care for, she mostly just seem spacy and a cloud cuckoo lander with a weird personality. That is the in and out of her character, her route itself was very intriguing but I just didn’t like the character.

I thought the music and sound effects in this would be nothing special but I should have stopped being surprised at this point because it’s also really well done. Each tune that comes out serves a purpose and does what it sets out to do and what mood it wants to portray. It surprisingly has a lot of tunes in the music bank for this game and quite a few little background sounds to really add to the atmosphere.

Overall I really did like the game and Semyon was a treat to follow, as a protagonist he’s interesting since he seems to be a NEET and an Otaku at the beginning but can slowly turn from this to anything else depending on which girl you follow.
Also I do have to say that this is a visual novel so there’s quite a bit of reading to set the scene and atmosphere of Semyons life at the beginning and that can really put people off but it’s not like the game has an hour of reading between each choice, on the contrary, there’s quite a lot of choices once you to the pioneer camp.

I’d say just give it a shot, it’s free so what’s the worst that can happen from a free game.

reviewText:
8/10.
This is the first game I have ever put in the effort to give a review on, which is saying quite a bit :D
It has an emotional and thought-provoking story (or should I say stories, because it has many endings)
It has a good story (stories...), a lot of replay value (multiple good/bad/neutral endings).  The path I took in my first playthrough was about 7-8 hours; despite being one of the bad endings, it still left me satisfied with the story (some of the endings are very... sad, and I don't reccomend doing Miku's route late at night o.O).  It has good visuals/graphics to go along with the story (and as of yet, no voice acting; in my oppinion it isn't even needed to enjoy the game).  The english translation is a bit shakey at times but bearable, and they say they are looking for someone to help with their translations.
Would reccommend.

reviewText:
Fantastic visual novel. The plot is extremely interesting and fascinating, and you don't want to stop playing. The dialouge is great, the characters are dynamic, and overall it's a fun, laid back game. This is also a great game that can bring on emotions so brace yourself! The few problems are: 1) Grammatical errors occur now and then, 2) Sometimes the dialogue between characters can be back and forth in a weird and generally confusing manner, 3) some endings are kind of suprising in a negative way, due to the fact that a big build up may occur and the ending is subtle, and 4) It it heavily restricted on 18+ even though Valve censored the game and cut out all sexually explicit scenes.
Overall I reccommend this to any 16+ year old who likes a story and plot to keep you hooked and a really fun time.

PERSONAL IN DEPTH REVIEW: For a free game, this took 17+ hours to complete 100%. That in itself is amazing and worth the download. This game is so philisohpical and touching that it is my favorite visual novel so far. I'm not one for emotional games or anything but this had just the right amount in it and it was brilliant. Seriously, give this game a try you may be suprised on how sophisticated and deep the storyline is. You can get a brain freeze (the good kind, like eating a slurpee too fast) from playing this game.  Fantastic, wonderful, and captivating. Hope you have as much fun as I did playing it.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
SPOILER FREE!

Story 7.5/10

As many other reviews state, you'll have a better understanding of what is going on after completing all 13 endings. You'll miss out on a lot if you only do one ending and uninstall.
However, after finishing all the endings, I still do not understand how the situation came to be or how it is hapenning. I may be daft or perhaps I missed something, but it is never explained. The story would have been that much better if everything was explained. Now this doesn't make Everlasting Summer a terrible novel. I still enjoyed the experience.

Characters 8/10

There are some lovable characters in this game. You may or may not get attached to some of the characters. I, personally, liked most of them quite a bit. I was never bored with the pioneers or staff. There is slight character development with some of the girls.

Writing 9/10

The writing was well written. It kept me on the edge of my seat as well as in tears. The English is great by the way. They obviously didn't use Google Translate.

Setting 8/10

The setting is interesting considering the situation the main character is in. I suppose it has to do with the developer, but nonetheless still interesting. Does it contribute to the story? Not really.

Music 9/10

The music, to me, is an important part of a visual novel. Most of the music is great for setting the mood. Gets the tears flowing, know what I'm sayin'?

Overall Impression 8/10

It was good, but not the best. I would still recommend it. Don't let this be your first visual novel though.

reviewText:
NOTE: Don't look at my game time as an indicator of actual game length. I often left the game running while doing other things. This review is based on one playthrough, the Alisa - Bad ending. No more information on that path will be given, to avoid spoilers.

Before I start this review, I'd like to point out that as at the time of my playthrough, the steam version of the game is censored. The game is designed to incorporate adult imagery. For that reason, and my otherwise enjoyment of adult imagery, I'd recommend googling the instructions on how to uncensor the game.

---

Everlasting Summer is a free to play Russian Visual Novel. You play as Semyon, an introverted loner. One winter's night, while riding on a bus in a busy metropolitan area, Semyon falls asleep. When he awakens, he finds he's been mysteriously transported to a remote youth camp and it's now mid-summer. Semyon and the reader are placed abruptly in this new environment and we're both left to ponder what has happened. The journey from this point paints a nice story. A little bit of mystery, a little coming of age. The game sold a nice image of camp life and had me wishing I'd given camp a shot. The story wasn't in any hurry to be told and felt a little lingery in places. This was despite a literal and figurative desire to try and uncover what happened to bring us here. We always seemed too busy camping" to find out. And as abruptly as we're placed in this setting
date: so are we abruptly removed from it at the end (at least in the Alisa - Bad ending route)
recommended: leaving us scratching our heads as to what had transpired.\n\nAll in all
hoursPlayed: it was a nice story
voteText: with some degree of decision making on the readers part. However
helpfulPercent: I did feel that we weren't given enough opportunity to make decisions
votesHelpful: especially meaningful ones. This was also the feeling that resulted as we lingered too long and didn't peruse the mystery of our presence here. At the end of the day
votesTotal: I had to remind myself that I was
votesFunny: for the most part
commentsCount: a passenger to this story
column16: not the pilot; this is a Visual Novel
column17: not a RPG/Choose Your Own Adventure.\n\nThe game was originally written in Russian
column18: but has since been translated into English. The translations don't appear to be professionally done
column19: with a number of minor translation faults
column20: especially in the latter parts of the game. These small faults don't take away from the game or lead to any confusion in with regards to the story
column21: but I feel it should be pointed out regardless. If anything
column22: the faults add in small part to the charm of the game. At times
column23: when strict translations don't exist
column24: such as for Russian products
column25: dishes or concepts
column26: the game presents a sidebar explaining the terms.\n\nThe visuals of this visual novel were a little hit and miss. The environment and setting art was quite pretty and quite effectively sold the setting of the camp. The characters however felt a little less complete. They often came across a little too repetitive and static. Part of the visuals of this style of visual novel should serve to attract and sell the reader on the characters; who we like
column27: who we hate and who we wish to get with. As such
column28: they should have a greater array of visuals with more character and expression. When it's the same pose and default faces every time
column29: you don't get that. Another letdown was the "cut scenes”. They were a little too sketchish and a little less "beauty shot". They came across more like concept art rather than final hero piece.\n\nThe music of Everlasting Summer was quite beautiful. I often find the music of games to be annoying when I'm away from the game doing other things
column30: or in cases like this game when there's little other sounds so you're hearing the same songs over and over again. This was not the case in Everlasting Summer. I have actually had gone back to the games website to listen to the soundtrack (available for free). There's the occasional foley sound effect in the game as well
column31: but these are minor.\n\nOne downside of the game is the achievements. There are 13 different endings
column32: each having an achievement linked to it. So to unlock all the achievements
column33: you need to complete at least 13 playthroughs to unlock all the paths. This approach encourages researching the right decision combos rather than acquiring them organically.\n\nOverall
column34: Everlasting Summer was quite an enjoyable (and free) Visual Novel. The “dating sim” aspect of the game may not appeal to all readers (it’s less pronounced than in some of its ilk) and the lack of definitive answers

reviewText: This is by far the best free game I've ever played.  I've got close to 30 hours in and I'm close to finishing all possible story lines.  I really wish there were more games like this. Otherwise, the character development is great, it's easy to navigate, and it continues to be entertaining every single time you play.  I'd pay money for this one!

reviewText:
First of all:
This is my first review and my main language isnt english so bear with me.

TL;DR:
Just play it. It's a frigging free to play game for ♥♥♥♥ sake.

Somewhat long version:
Everlasting Summer is a Visual Novel. If you are in this game page, I take that you know what that means. You wont play anything. You will read trough hours of text and conversations while choosing what to do sometimes, and it's pretty much it. So if you dont like this type of games, you are in the wrong place.

This is a russian game, so the in-game culture will pretty much be russian, what not necessarily is a bad thing, but you can find it weird or confusing sometimes, so just bear with it.

The art of the game is good. sometimes you can see anything a little off about the art, but it's nothing big, it just adds to create a unique style.

The game has 14 finals, some are good, some are bad, some are creepy as ♥♥♥♥, but all of them are good nonetheless.
You maybe will need  a guide for some finals for they are ridiculously hard to get or even discover, but it's the history that counts so it's fine.

The game history is very cliche, and there is nothing wrong with that, cause the real focus of the game are the characters. How you interact with them, how the MC can take diferent decisions in the same situations if he is with girl A or B, how the MC can change thing in the world. Like a Gundam anime: The journey is more important than the final result.

With a score of 93/100 i will recommend this game. there are some small flaws here and there, but they doesnt make this game worse. This is a good game, just play it.

reviewText: Sometimes, things transcend languages.  Cute girls are one of them.  I am biased, but this is a good visual novel.  Somethings are predictable, others not so much.  Still, it has good pacing in two languages.  Don't know what more you can reccomend a visual novel for.\n\nAnyways, I hope you give it a try, if for no other reason than its a free game.  And given the amount of content put into this, I'm surprised that they did not try to charge for it.  There have been other visual novels that were far less interesting that cost far more.  Anyways, give this a shot.  You could very easily enjoy yourself.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
I find this game to stand out more than the other generic visual novels that I have stumbled upon. Everlasting Summer, made by Soviet Games has opened my eyes, about the meaning of life. I've never encountered a game that made me empathize for the characters. The main character and I have some similarities, we both are somewhat anti-social, lazy, but most of all depressed and lonely. We both don't have special someone to lean on each other's shoulders and just cry. This game has a some influencing moral lessons that will affect you in someway. Everlasting Summer happened to be the first visual novel i've ever played.

I don't happen to have any complaints about this game. Everything looks beautiful, the visuals, graphics, especially the girls. The game has a unique story unlike many other visual novels.

Be prepared to experience the feels when you complete this game.

Thanks a lot, Soviet Games. I'm looking towards your next game, Love Money Rock-n-Roll.

I know it's only my business,but it was my first visual novel.It was just chosen accidentally,and I can say that it was totally worth the try.This affected on me seriously,because I had similarities with Semyon.(When I'm writing this review,it should be known that I've changed my username to Semyon for a few days.) Even two of the storylines touched my heart.(It's not hard to find out which ones I mean :D )
The main storylines(of the four girls) can be found easily,if you do it mindful.Some tries(or a guide) are needed for the remaining ones.
The side stories were interesting too.Both of Winter Tale and Winter Miracle had a small twist - comparing to the main one.You should download them.

The graphics and the soundtracks are well made.Some of the graphics are beatiful,some of them are mediocre.
I would advise you to download the hentai/adult content from the ofiicial page.Not because it's about perversion,but it can make some emotionally strong moments a bit deeper.(I won't say spoiler about which ones I mean.)

The only bad thing is the contents of the community.It's a Russian-made game,so it's logical that there are a lof of Russian-based posts.(In other words:most of the contents' language is Russian.No offense.) reviewText:
Still playing all the routes. So far I have enjoyed it very much. The story manages to keep itself interesting right to the end, which is quite a feat. This is helped by the fact there's an underlying (mystery-related) plot.

I haven't really found anything I dislike. Sure, the English could be a bit better (I see a few grammar mistakes and typos every so often) but it still makes sense and I'm grateful there is an English translation.

Overall, I found Everlasting Summer to be enjoyable. Also, it's free- thats some extreme value for (no) money.

Update: Finished the game. I maintain my view that it is interesting right till the end. The music and backgrounds are also great. As some others have mentioned, the artwork is inconsistent in places (various full-screen character-shots) but I'm fine with it. It portrays what it needs to and backs up the story nicely.

reviewText:
Everlasting Summer frequently switches it's genre from mystery, to fantasy, to slice of life with almost no regard for the reader's sanity. That being said, it did so surprisingly well. The premise of another time and another world is so overused in modern video games, books, and movies; whoop-de-doo, another protagonist find him/herself stuck in another world and is trying to get home. The difference between these stories and Everlasting Summer's is that, you forget that it's a fantasy, you forget this isn't real. Characters felt well-thought out and I found myself impressed and surprised at the amazing storytelling, but enough generalizations.

Pros:
+The length: I consider myself a fast reader and I put 40+ hours into the game. If you're looking for something good to occupy your time with, this is it.
+Well-rounded characters: the archetypes felt a little overdone, but well done all the same
+The background art: beautifully done. I don't believe I have seen such detail in almost any other visual novel I've come across, let alone a free one.
+The Premise: alright most people don't go deep into it, but hear me out. It was believable; obviously it's fantasy, but how many times have you fallen asleep or zoned out for a minute and had no idea where you were? I actually did enjoy the smooth, quick transition to the main story.
+The Varied Endings: I won't tell any spoilers, but daaaaaaaaaang, I was not expecting some of those. Every piece of the story feels like a separate novel and that's what makes it work. The difference is, little incongruencies kept popping up that made you scratch your head and want to know what the heck was going on. But the mastery was the fact that it all came together in the end. Beautifully done.

Cons:
- The length: If you're looking for full completion on all routes or all achievements quickly, don't even look at this.
-The Main Character: there were times when I was left wondering what Semyon was possibly thinking and others when he was seemingly the most intelligent person in the camp. Just a little nitpicky with the consistencies.
-The Choices: I love when you are able to choose your own adventure." It really helps immerse the player in what's going on in the story
date: but some of the choices were a little ridiculous while some just seemed like they were thrown together for a last minute draft. Not a big deal
recommended:
just a tad strange.

Overall: 9/10

Everlasting Summer is an amazing story with real characters and a fantastic mix of plot lines. The writers did an amazing job of pulling the reader in and making them feel the characters. I almost feel guilty for not paying for it and you SHOULD feel guilty if you don't get it."

reviewText: Amazing amazing game, I have to say I didn't expect much seeing as it was free, but it was actually really good! It had a nice sort of sci-fi/mystery plot which I absolutely loved! The artwork is pretty good, in some areas it could use a bit of improvement but it also had its moments of greatness, too. In the end, I would actually pay real money for this game, and I'm surprised such an amazing game is available for free, so if you're a fan of visual novels/dating games like me, definitely get this! The protagonist is a straight man, but I'm a heterosexual girl and still enjoyed the game, so you don't have to be attracted to girls to enjoy this! Even if you're not into the dating aspect the story alone is worth the download.

reviewText:
I am more than pleased with my download of this game. I enjoyed most of the characters and their paths. The music was well picked. The multiple endings were numerous.

When I look for a visual novel there are aspects I want.
1. Choices throughout the game:
these don't need to be giant factors in the game that need to effect end game. Just enough to change how a scene plays out. Everlasting Summer score 9/10
2. Multiple endings:
I enjoy a replay value. I like a good ending and a bad ending and more important a vastly different ending. Score 9/10
3. Animation and CG:
I want things polished more than I want things to just exist in the game. Ideally I want pretty graphics and CG scenes (possibly interactive). Everlasting summer 6.5/10. This was the weakest point for the game and i'm surprised with such a small company and staff it wasn't worse. Even more, I was happy with what I got. I still have a full gallery and unique art that you wont find in the j visual novels.
4. Music:
The music is extremely important and has to be appropriate. If you dont understand, try watching Star Wars footage without the music. If the music isn't appropriate, it kills the mood and the attachment to the world. 9/10 There's a large library of music listed. I just wish there was a little more unique and flushed music with Alisa's route.
5. Story/Writing:
It's a visual novel. A novel can't be good without story and writting, simple as that. 8/10. I felt cheated with a route where I follow a voice and then zero explaination (I assumed I died?). A couple other hic ups here and there. The character can really just go off into a monolgue. The writing also had a lot of allusions to other works and pop culture which i enjoyed for the most part. It was also written well enough for me to play through every route. I can't say it's on the level of writing like Critical Point (the writers from UC gundam worked on that visual novel), but it's a great start.

Overall 8/10. It was for the most part what I wanted. And that doesn't factor that this game was free. These ratings have no pulled punches as this was a professional quality of work. I look forward to the next one: Love, Money, Rock'n'Roll.

reviewText:
Everything was written before me.

And while one can say this game has drawbacks (and a bona-fide yandere transplanted into a Soviet summer camp, oh my!), it still comes close to bringing tears to my eyes.
Close.

That is an achievement in itself. Regardless of what some might say about the game being an endless collection of obscure references (you never know!), it still came close to Death of Optimus Prime" on my personal emotional scale.

Bear in mind
date: that some of the game's "completion paths" or "routes" may appear counter-intuitive to you... so if you fancy yourself a highly logical person
recommended: you might as well not bother and go straight for the solution charts. Even then you'll hardly find the game lacking."

reviewText:
After playing through a number of visual novels, I would say this game is quite good. It has a unique storyline and although sometimes not so clear, as you play along and ponder upon the path and different endings, players will begin to understand more and more on the journey to redemption and value of life.

Pro:
- Good storyline
- Plenty of girls
- A unique experience of learning some Russian cultures
- Great background music which will makes you love them
- Let you ponder back on your life (if you indulge yourself in the story)

Cons:
- Arts a bit inconsistent (still I enjoy the style of drawing)
- Mind boggling storyline (if players cannot think how they connect)
- no Olga storyline (got letdown here T.T )

Well, the cons aren't that great that you should take notice. Remember that this game is more of storyline and putting yourself into the story. You will learn a lot from the story and girls too. Final rating: 10/10.

reviewText: This game is amazing if you have nothing to do. It took me about 3 hours of actually playing it to figure out what I'm supposed to do. But when you do find out the mechanics it's all uphill from there. This manga is so in depth, and most of the characters have 2 endings to find. I found the best part is trying to find out what the right choice is and then finding out that I screwed up at one point, but that's the fun you will have. I recommend this because the depth of the characters is so real, so lifelike, that I found myself trying to find out each choice and what effect it will have in the future. This is one of the games that uses the Butterfly Effect. If you don't know what that is, basically it's the theory that if you do one thing, another will happen. Basically think of it as choosing classes in high school. You can choose to be in, say, French with your friends and just goof around, or you can take a class like Spanish and actually learn something. And the fun of it is that if you choose one choice you won't know what happened if you chose the other. I really recommend this because of the fun you will have, the emotions you will feel, and the memories you will make.

reviewText: Woke up and realized how empty and sad Semyon's life is; Much like my own. Had a weird dream, woke up and got on a bus. Wake up and end up in a strange camp. Get lost in a fallout-esque shelter. Save a tsundere's life from an insane geek. Fall in love with a seemingly shy girl that turns out to be a physco yandere. Have fight with yandere. Wake up and everyone is gone aside from me and yandere. Confess my feeling for yandere and we bang. Fall asleep with yandere. Wake up and tell her we should get going or we'll starve. Yandere starts packing and told me to get my stuff and meet up in the square in ten minutes. I get my stuff and wait for 30 minutes. I rush back to yandere's cabin to find she's slit her arm from her elbow to her wrist. I tell her normal people cut down the street, not down the road. I cry profusely. I run out of camp in a mad rage covered in blood and find the bus. Get on the bus and fall asleep. Wake up in my room and have a nervous breakdown, because I don't know what's real anymore. Down a whole packet of sedatives and listen to sad music. Light a candle and make a metaphor about how life is like a candle, because why the ♥♥♥♥ not? Go take a relaxing bath..... In my own blood. Whispers to myself about how I'll see yandere again. Everything goes black. *Acheivement unlocked: Cut down the road, not the street.* *Acheivement unlocked: Lena Bad Ending* 10/10 Would kill myself again.-IGN

reviewText:
I was bored and looking for the games to play at Steam and i found this. Everlasting Summer.
I looked at the intro video and then people's reviews about it and i thought what is it in this game that it has so many positive reviews.
It was free so i thought i wont lose anything if i try it and damn i did not expect that it was this good, infact it was better than good.

Very few of the games i have played has created emotions in me and it has been a long time since i have had any emotions with the game's story. Everlasting Summer did just that and i would want to give my thanks to the developers who made this and same time hit them to the face, you will know what i mean when you play it.

I dont want to tell spoilers or anything but i warn you that if you get your emotions in to this game like i did, it has power to hurt you deeply.

There is one thing i did not like about this game and it was some of the choice's you had to make. This game has choice's and your choice's will make your ending and there are multiple endings. Some of the choice's are just stupid and you simply can not know what will happen with that choice and it can give you an ending that literally sucks.

Nevertheless, Everlasting Summer is one of the best if not The most best visual novels i have played. It is a world where you want to go back again.
I will remember this game because i remember what it felt like playing it and i loved it.

If you are skeptical about this game like i was first, then remember that it is free and you have nothing to lose. How do you know that you dont like it before you try it.

reviewText:
I freakin' love this. Great pictures, great storylines(yes, storylines), great soundtrack, and many choices that await just around the corner. It's one of those games where choices REALLY matter and you have to make sure to pick the right ones. Although, there's no way of telling whether the choices you made were good or bad until the ending. Another thing: this game likes to stick to your mind. Like, really stick. You'll go to bed later on wondering what you could've done better and weeping with a broken heart because you got seperated from a character in the game which you felt something for, or you could have a smile on your face because you're with someone you really like and got the good end with them. Honestly, this game has made me feel things i've never felt before - e.g: Inspiration, saudade, love, depression... It's really touching. This game has taught me a few things, and I abide by them to this day. It's changed my perspective on things, how I act, what to do in situations, and I even managed to gain myself a girlfriend :D

I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone. Trust me, it's worth your time ;)

-1 point for making me cry xD
Seriously, amazing work Soviet Games!

reviewText:
7/10

Quite a good VN, totally worth a read. Give it a try, it's free anyways. Though, I'd still pay for it if I had to.

The characters are quite standard. The main character is some guy that had nothing to do in life, tried several jobs but didn't work out, used to have friends, but now spends his life at his monitor, spamming F5.. Then some day, he suddenly wakes up at the gates of some weird-♥♥♥ summer camp. He gets introduced to everyone, but finds out, he might not be leaving any time soon. And, how/why did he even get there?

The game has a nice mystery element to it as he tries to find a way out. I still don't understand everything in the plot, but nothing is really over-the-top or very weird/overfantasized.

The music is really amazing, I loved most of the songs playing in the background. Fits in well with the scenes too.

The art is good. Nothing really much to comment on it. Has some nicely drawn scenes, though also some that were a bit.. meh, not bad, but not really inspiring/original either.

It still has some typoes here and there, but it shouldn't make the VN any less readable.

reviewText:
As a noob to this type of game genre here is my review:
I've never played an interactive visual novel video game before. It was so good that pretty much played it for 10 hours straight. I LOVE this game/ story, it's so good. The music is great, the story is great, and the art is great.

The only two real problem? Since it was originally made in Russian there are quite of bit of typos. However, with recent patches they are fixing that. Also, it is kind of disheartening to want to go path/ ending, and not realizing you have enough to get it at the end.

Depite some problems I give it an 11/10; this makes me want to play more things like it in the future, after I 100% it. The FEELS are real, get ready for it if you try it out yourself. Y_Y

I just wish it was more accessible instead of me always having to log into steam for it. This game will stay in my heart until the end of time.

Definitely worth the download, would play money for it 100%.

reviewText:
Anyone who has disliked this probably doesn't like to read.

Which shows the lacking of intellect in today's generation but HEY! Life.

Anyway... I quickly found my self in a slightly relating situation. The protagonist has similar situations to what many have today, leading to a sense of realism and ties between the reader/player and the character. Simply put, the story (from what I have seen so far) is great. One of the best, quickly coming up to Katawa Shoujo.

Though... I would've liked to seen better art, but the story will set for me. For others, I have no idea. Any whom, I suggest that those who love a good story that shows emotion, and managers to pull in through the first few minutes, play this game. Read it's content.

reviewText: I've played countless VNs before, some of those that are critically aclaimed, and those that are lesser known. I came across this one in particular, and recalled almost laughing at the fact that it was in my eyes, a random free VN. Expecting it be to rated poorly, the outstanding support got me to download it.\n\nNormally, I would have looked up a walkthrough for whichever character I liked best, and actually attempted this at first only to find out there is jack-all about this VN out there. Reddit has made mentions of it, although it's rarely upvoted, and vndb lacks anything besides the bare bones. TV Tropes doesn't mention it, and there is no walkthrough" from what I've seen

reviewText: This is the first time ive ever played a visual novel/dating sim before, so I was very open in my expectations of this game. I had no idea what to expect. Would it be fast, slow, interesting or just to look at cute girls? But this game, i guess its more of a story then game, is MIND BOGGLING. My hours spent are a little misleading, because I found an iPhone version and have been using that since i can travel with it, my hours are probably dawning on 25/30 at this point. I cant give anything away (that wouldnt be fun anyway), but i can say that once is not enough. You have to play through and test things (at least 4 times, that's what it took for me) to get the real story, and I mean the real , honest to god story. forget what other reviews say, about the artwork or the translation (which is glitchy but i could understand it fully, and the backrounds are gorgeous. The people, while simple, are also well done) the story behind this game is by far enough, to say the least. Just to re-itterate, i was ASTOUNDED by this games storyline. Ive found few other books that can compare. For a free game and my first attempt at this genre, I am honest to god stunned. Happy reading!
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Simply a wonderful interactive novel.

The protaganist starts out apathetic and fatalistic, but each of the women he builds a relationship with teaches him something different about life, and motivates his post-camp character in different ways.

The really interesting part is when you finish all the other endings to unlock the final ending - the game gets very metafictional, referring to the previous times you played the game.


Definitely looking forward to more from the developers.
